intro: Enkianthus perulatus f. japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese Enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features broad, elliptical leaves with a glossy texture. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to the landscape.
